title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
Hello,
this 820-3476 is not turning on. It has an orange light in the charger and there is no visible damage on the board.
PP5V_S4 is not there because PM_SLP_S4_L is also missing. I checked U1900 and i ge a 1V p-p clock signal on pin 12 (on my oszilloskop) so i think this is fine.
U1950 is missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD. Here it gets a bit confusing for me. As far as i understand PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK is needed for the CPU/PCH to work. But this is created by ALL_SYS_PWRGD. This needs a bunch S0 Rails to be created. But as PM_SLP_S4_L is missing on this board it is not in a S0 state. So i am back to PM_SLP_S4_L not beeing created.
Would be really great if somebode could give me a short explanation of how this works, what comes on first and help me fix this.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: First thing to determine is if the board is power cycling. Check if PP5V_S4 is pulsing, best to do with scope. If not then check PPVRTC. Also check all rails for shorts.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
PP5V_S4 is straight 0V - even if i put the scope to 0.1 us/div. Same thing for PPVRTC_G3H. There was indeed a short on PP5V_S4. I slowly injected voltage in there (starting at 0.9 V - 3.5 V were enough to feel something getting hot) and U8300 got hot. I replced it. The short is gone now (0.377 V to GND in diode mode)  but still no PM_SLP_S4_L and still 0V on PP5V_S4 without pulsing. Also PPVRTC is still not pulsing. I checked ll other rails for shorts and two of the readings are a little low i think. 

PP1V35_S3_CPUDDR (and the other ram rails are similar) = 0.09V to GND in diode mode. This may still be ok because its a small circuit with low voltage on it...
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 0.031V to GND in diode mode. I think that is the problem.
should i inject voltage in there (up to max. 1.5 V) and see what gets hot? I am always careful if it comes to shorts on VCORE...

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: ..........Never mind

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: PPVRTC should be present. Check for short and replace U1900 as that generates it. U8300 probably got killed by connecting a shorted or damaged LCD cable. Inspect cable and connector.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: I wanted to say, that PPVRTC is also straight and not pulsing. But it is present - straight 3,3 V. Sorry, my english is not the best. LCD cable and connector look fine and i get 0,38 V to GND in diode mode at pin 28, 29 and 30 (with the LCD cable plugged in).

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: 3V3_S5 present? PPBUS voltage? I suspect that there is some more history to this board, U8300 does not "just" die like that.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: PP3V3_S5 is 3.341 V and PPBUS_G3H is 12.61 V. The only thing the customer said is that it just stopped working... And the whole machine looks near perfekt (inside and outside...)

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: What are resistance to GND values on those 2 rails with low diode mode reading?

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
PP1V35_S3_CPUDDR  : ~255 Ohm (multimeter counting up and down -+10 Ohm) 
PPVCC_S0_CPU           : <70 Ohm (multimeter slowly counting down)

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: That is within what I would call fine. At this point it could be anything and you really need to find some history. No way U8300 just died, no way in hell. See if you can find any other shorted rails too.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: I contacted the customer today and he said, that he left the macbook copying some files to an external drove and as he came back it was dead... I checked all rails listed in the scematic and they are all not shorted as far as i can tell. Few of them have a readings of 0.13 V in diode mode to GND (others up to 0.6 V).

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
The external drive is a hint. U8300 is on 5V so I bet the 5V got hit with some spike though USB. Measure resistance to GND on all 5V_s3 S0 and compare to known good. It is not looking good though :(
Also ask if they are using China garbage charger as that is what usually causes weird current loops that kill machines like this, due to bad insulation from mains power.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: I am not sure if i did the right thing but i measured the resistances on all these rails. I attached a document where i compared it to a working 820-3462 (as that is the closest equivalent working board i have) and i also added the components where i took the measurements. I hope that hepls but even if it did not help this time i have the readings to compare other 820-3462 boards in the future to...

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Not seeing anything that is worrying. Is 3v3_sus present?

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: yes it is at pin 8 of the Bios chip 3.34 V

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: This is getting shitty. SMC_ADAPTER_EN present?

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Ugh :(. Is there any pulse on PM_SLP_S4_L? Check while connecting power, it may happen just once. Use a scope and set "one shot" mode to be able  to capture it.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Yes, it is pulsing for a second but after that it is back to 0 V. I only have a CRT so i took a photo with my phone as good as i could. Hope that is good enought...

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: What is the time base and volts/div here? Check if ALL_SYS is showing the same behavior too.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: That was at 50 mV/div and 5 us/div. All_SYS_PWR_GD shows a different behaviour. If i connect the adapter it just has a single pulse to ~3 V but it is so fast that i cant capture it. After that its back to 0 V.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: The 3V spike on ALL_SYS would suggest the board tries to power on once. I still suspect a short on a rail or possible corrupt BIOS.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: I measured the resistance of all rails and added the values to the table. The new values are blue. I added a picture. I will  try a new Bios chip today too and let you know if that changes something...

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: I also swapped the BIOS but still no PM_SLP_S4_L

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: having same issue waiting from some ones help

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Make your own thread with measurements etc.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Was the BIOS from an identical board and are you sure it has a good binary in it?

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: The bios was from the same board (820-3476-A). I have no idea how i can know if the binary is good?

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: You read it with programmer. The chips on some of the China boards are erased. If it was a donor that was not from China then it is probably fine.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: I put the original Bios IC back on and read the china Bios with my progeammr and a new small PCB where i can solder these Bios ICs on. It is not empty and can be read without any errors.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: It may very well be a dead CPU then. I am out of ideas otherwise, sorry.

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
No Title

No problem. Thank you for the outstanding help. Even if it it may be dead i could learn the troubleshooting process. 
In the mean time i got another 820-3476 in (i could fix this one and it still works fine). So i took all resistance measurements again from this working board, added the values to my sheet and uploaded it here. Only PP5V_S4 and PP5V_S0 are noticable lower than the values from the working board. So maybe this could be the last chance for this board...

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
I have no explanation for this! No idea why PM_SLP_S4_L was missing. (this signal is really confusing to me) But i followed the lower resistance values (even if the diode mode readings were the same - i also dont really understand how that could be) and there are only three places where PP5V_S4 and PP5V_S0 meet. And only U8080 makes sense here. So i replaced U8080. The diode mode readings did not change but the resistance readings came back up and - i could not belive it- the board turns on. So i dont know what to say at this ponit except thank you very much for your great help and patience.
You and this whole forum are amazing!!!

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Wow, you got a very lucky fix on this one!

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Hi Duke!! I have same board with pulsing on PP5V_S4 and PP5V_S0, Can you give me a hand? Thanks :)

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN is ok, ppbus is ok,PM_SLP_S4_L is pulsing ! PPVRTC is ok!

Sorry and let me know if i have to open new topic, and i will!! Sorry but this case is very very near to mine!!

Thanks

title: 820-3476 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
message: Make a new thread!
